course_title: Fresh Sem: IDS: Plato's Republic in Cont.Persp
class_notes:
(Freshmen Seminar - Limited to First Year Students Only)
(Plato's most complex and influential dialogue, the Republic, has caused controversy for over 2500 years, surrounding topics such as: authoritarianism, the source of moral action, education, censorship, political deception, the corrupting force of art, the nature of truth and science, and the afterlife. Students will read the Republic in its entirety, then compare this ancient philosophical work to contemporary texts, including films (e.g. Network, The Matrix, The Truman Show and the series Black Mirror), music (e.g. Childish Gambino, This is America), and literature (e.g. selections from Dostoyevsky and Hawthorne). Our goal will be to understand contemporary issues better through the lens offered by Plato.)
